thread.title: Cops bust 21-year-old man for Bronx stabbings
thread.title_full: Cops bust 21-year-old man for Bronx stabbings - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Cops bust 21-year-old man for Bronx stabbings
text:
Baba Diarra allegedly stabbed Sekou Touray in stomach repeatedly along Third Ave. near E. 166th St. in Morrisania early on September 26. Police busted a 21-year-old man who stabbed two people — one fatally — in the Bronx in September, cops said Thursday.
Baba Diarra surrendered himself in to cops and was charged with murder for allegedly stabbing 21-year-old Sekou Touray to death and then knifing his 22-year-old friend along Third Ave. near E. 166th St. in Morrisania at about 2:15 a.m. on September 26, according to authorities.
Diarra stabbed Touray repeatedly in the stomach, before attacking his friend, cops said. Both victims were taken to Lincoln Medical Center, but Touray could not be saved.
Diarra is facing murder, manslaughter and criminal possession of a weapon charges, according to police.
kortiz@nydailynews.com
Related Stories 2 stabbed, 1 fatally, in Bronx, Brooklyn attacks: cops Mayhem in 3 boroughs as 7 killed, 4 wounded from gunshots
